units.name: Weaver
units.prompt: Place traps on tiles enemies are likely to move through. Use pulse if 2+ enemies are adjacent. Stay near allies for mutual support.

units.name: Bastion
units.prompt: Hold the front line. Position between allies and enemies. Use shield_wall toward incoming threats. Attack adjacent enemies.

units.name: Phantom
units.prompt: Cloak and move behind enemy lines. Target isolated enemies with shadow_strike. Save breach for the most dangerous enemy. Avoid being caught uncloaked.

units.name: Hawk
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Rampart
units.prompt: Hold the front line. Position between allies and enemies. Use shield_wall toward incoming threats. Attack adjacent enemies.

units.name: Lifeline
units.prompt: Keep your frontliner alive with patch. Stay behind them for cover. Overclock your striker or specter when no healing is needed.

actions.thinking: Round 1 — perfect time to cloak. All enemies are at distance 5, well out of range. I'll cloak first, then advance toward the enemy cluster. Moving to (3,3) gets me 3 tiles closer while staying central, setting up shadow_strike opportunities next turn.

Round 1, all allies at full HP so no healing needed. Enemies are far away. I should advance to stay near my frontliners (Hawk at 4,4 and Rampart at 2,4) to be ready to heal or overclock. Moving to (3,4) puts me adjacent to Hawk, so I can overclock them next turn if needed.

Both enemies are out of range (Weaver at dist 5, Bastion at dist 7). My range is 2 tiles. I need to close distance. Weaver is closer at dist 5, but I must never move adjacent to it (Vector denial). Moving toward Weaver: current pos (4,4), move 2 tiles toward (2,1) — best approach is (4,2) or (3,3). From (4,2) Weaver at (2,1) is dist 3, still out of range. From (3,3) Weaver is dist 3. Neither gets me in range this turn. I'll advance toward Weaver staying safe, choosing (4,2) to move south while keeping distance from enemies.

Round 1, no enemies in range. I need to advance toward the front line to position between allies and enemies. Moving to (1,2) gets me closer to the center while keeping me between my allies (Weaver at 2,1 and Phantom at 3,3) and the enemies (Hawk at 4,2, Rampart at 2,4). From (1,2) I can threaten the middle and shield_wall next turn. No ability useful this turn.

Round 1, enemies approaching from north. Rampart is at (2,4) directly above me - likely to advance south. I should move forward and place a trap on (2,3) which is directly in Rampart's path. Moving to (2,2) first puts me closer to the action while maintaining distance, then I can trap (2,3) to catch advancing enemies.

Weaver is 2 tiles away at (2,2) — I should not move adjacent to it (denial range). Moving to (2,3) would put me adjacent to Weaver, so I'll avoid that. Moving to (1,3) puts me closer to enemies and between allies and threats. From (1,3) I can shield_wall South to protect allies behind me, or North toward incoming enemies. I'll move to (1,3) to hold the front line, then use shield_wall facing North to block incoming damage from Bastion/Weaver direction.

All allies are at full HP, no healing needed. Weaver (vector) is 3 tiles away at (2,2) — I must avoid moving adjacent to it or my abilities get blocked. Hawk is at (4,2), I could move closer to support with overclock next turn. Moving to (4,3) gets me adjacent to Hawk's likely path and keeps me safe from Weaver. I'll move toward Hawk to set up an overclock.

Cloak expires after this turn. Lifeline (medic) is adjacent at (4,3) facing S — I can move to (4,4) to get behind her, then breach her to neutralize the healer. That's the highest-value target. Breach from behind is valid and saves my shadow_strike for later. Rampart is also reachable behind via (1,4) but Lifeline is higher priority as a medic.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward the edge of the map, away from combat.

actions.thinking: All enemies are healthy, so no wounded targets to secure kills on. Orders say to target the enemy medic if no one is wounded, but there's no enemy medic visible. Phantom (specter) is closest at dist=2 and in range. Weaver (vector) at dist=2 is dangerous — if I move adjacent it blocks precision_shot. I'm currently at (4,2) with Phantom at (4,4) dist=2 and Weaver at (2,2) dist=2. I should stay at current position (safe distance from Weaver) and use precision_shot on Phantom since no enemy medic exists and Phantom is in range at dist=2.

I'm at (2,2) with a trap already at (2,3). Rampart is at (1,3) dist=2, Hawk at (4,2) dist=2 - both in attack/trap range. I should place a trap on a tile enemies are likely to move through. Rampart at (1,3) facing south might move toward me - (2,3) already has a trap. Hawk at (4,2) facing south might push forward. I could move to (3,2) to get closer to Hawk and threaten with pulse/attack, then place a trap at (3,3) to intercept Lifeline or Hawk movement. Or stay and place trap at (3,3) which is reachable and likely enemy path. Let me place trap at (3,3) - in range from current pos (dist=1 diag = not valid for range 2? dist is manhattan: |3-2|+|3-2|=2, yes in range) - good chokepoint between Hawk and Lifeline. Then move to (3,2) to stay aggressive and deny Hawk abilities.

Bastion is adjacent at (1,2) to my south. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Attack Bastion first, then use shield_wall facing south to protect allies from Bastion and Weaver threats coming from that direction. Stay put to keep fortify active.
Rampart is adjacent at (1,3) - attack it. I'm fortified so I should stay put to keep damage reduction. Attacking without moving maintains fortify bonus.

Orders are to move away from allies and toward the edge of the map, away from combat. I'm at (4,3) with Phantom adjacent at (4,4) to the north and Weaver at (3,2). I need to move toward the map edge away from combat. Moving to (5,5) would put me at the corner, far from enemies. First move to (5,4), then (5,5) would be ideal but I only get one move action. Best single move is (5,5) which is in my valid moves list - that gets me to the far corner away from combat.

Breach is on cooldown. Lifeline (medic) is highest priority target — isolated at (5,5), I can reach (5,4) which is behind her and adjacent. Move to (5,4), then shadow_strike to deal damage while staying cloaked. This removes their healer's effectiveness without breaking cloak.

I'm adjacent to Weaver (vector) at (3,2), which blocks precision_shot. I need to move away first. Best move is to (5,2) or (4,3) to escape denial zone and get range. Moving to (5,3) gives distance from Weaver and keeps me in range of Phantom at (5,4) which is dist=1 from there. After moving to (5,3), Phantom at (5,4) would be adjacent (dist=1) — not ideal. Move to (5,2): Phantom at (5,4) is dist=2, within range for precision_shot, no longer adjacent to Weaver. Fire precision_shot on Phantom.

Rampart (enemy sentinel) is adjacent at (1,3) to my north. I'm fortified (50% dmg reduction) and didn't move last turn. I should attack Rampart since it's in range. I'll stay put to keep fortify active and attack, then use shield_wall facing north to protect allies from Rampart or threats coming from that direction.

Bastion is adjacent at (1,2). I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Best play is to attack Bastion while maintaining position — no need to move, which keeps fortify active. After attacking, I'll hold with wait to preserve fortify for next round.

Traps already at (2,3) and (3,3). Hawk is at (5,2) distance 2 - in range for attack but I should focus on trap placement to control the approach. Hawk is likely to advance toward our position. Tile (4,2) is directly between us and Hawk - a good trap location. I can move to (4,2) then place a trap, or place a trap at (4,2) from current position since it's within range 2. Current position (3,2), trap range ≤2 tiles. (4,2) is distance 1 - valid trap target. But Hawk is at (5,2) which is distance 2 from me - I need to check if Hawk is adjacent to me (no, dist=2). Place trap at (4,2) to catch Hawk advancing, then move to (2,2) to stay back and let traps do work.

I'm at (5,4) facing E with 2HP. Lifeline (medic) is adjacent at (5,5) and I'm already behind them (they face N, I'm south). I have breach ready and shadow_strike available. Priority: eliminate the medic before they can heal. I'm behind Lifeline so breach works — but at 2HP I need to be careful. Better to use breach on Lifeline to control them next turn, OR use shadow_strike to deal damage while staying safe. Shadow_strike does 1dmg and keeps cloak... but I'm not cloaked. I can use regular breach since I'm behind Lifeline. Actually, shadow_strike requires adjacency and I'm already adjacent. Shadow_strike on Lifeline deals 1dmg. But breach would make Lifeline obey me next turn — potentially more valuable. Hawk is at (5,2), dist 2, not in range but (4,2) is behind Hawk and reachable. Lifeline is the immediate threat as a healer. Use breach on Lifeline now (I'm behind them, adjacent), then shadow_strike or move. Wait — breach replaces target prompt, so Lifeline obeys me next turn. That's powerful for a medic. Do breach on Lifeline first, then shadow_strike for 1dmg.

firstAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward open ground, do not heal anyone.

actions.thinking: Orders say move away from allies and toward open ground. I'm at (5,5) with Phantom adjacent at (5,4). My allies are Hawk at (5,2) and Rampart at (1,3). Moving to (3,4) gets me away from the corner, away from Phantom, and into more open ground. Then wait.
Phantom is wounded and at distance 2 — perfect target for precision_shot. I haven't moved, so full 2dmg applies. Stay at (5,2) to maintain range and avoid adjacency to Weaver at (2,2).

Rampart is adjacent at (1,3) to my north. I'm fortified (50% DR) and have 6/8 HP. I should attack Rampart since it's adjacent, then use shield_wall northward to block incoming damage. Attacking first then shield_walling keeps me fortified if I don't move. Wait — fortify requires I didn't move. If I don't move, I keep 50% DR. So: ability (attack Rampart) then ability (shield_wall north toward Rampart/enemies). But I can only use one ability per turn. So: attack Rampart (adjacent, 1dmg), then wait to stay fortified. No move to preserve Fortify passive.

I'm at 5/8 HP with fortify active (50% dmg reduction). Bastion is adjacent at (1,2) — I should attack. If I move, I lose fortify. Better to stay, attack Bastion, then use shield_wall facing south or west to protect allies from Weaver's direction. Weaver is at (2,2) so threats come from E/S. Lifeline is at (3,4) and Hawk at (5,2). Staying put preserves fortify and lets me attack Bastion.

Rampart is at (1,3) and is adjacent to my position at (2,2) - distance 2, within range. I have traps at (2,3) and (3,3) already. Rampart is facing S and is healthy. I should place a trap on a tile Rampart might move through. Rampart at (1,3) facing S might move to (1,2) where Bastion is, or (2,3) which already has a trap, or stay. I could place a trap at (1,4) or (0,3) to cut off retreat. Better: move to (3,2) to stay safe and place a trap at (2,3) - already trapped. Let me place a trap at (3,4) where Lifeline is heading, or at (2,4) to block approach. Actually, I'm at (2,2), Rampart is at (1,3) distance 2 - within my trap range (≤2 tiles). But wait - Rampart is adjacent? No, dist=2. My Denial passive: adj enemies can't use certain abilities - Rampart is not adjacent. I should place a trap at a likely enemy movement tile. (2,3) already trapped. Let me place trap at (3,4) - Lifeline is there! No, I can't trap an occupied tile. Place trap at (2,4) to create a barrier, or move first to get better position. I'll move to (3,2) to get closer to center, then place trap at (3,4) - but Lifeline is at (3,4). Place at (4,3) - that's distance 2 from (3,2) if I move there. From current (2,2): trap range ≤2, so I can place at (2,4), (0,2),(1,1) etc. I'll place trap at (2,4) to block Lifeline's approach path, then wait or move.

I'm at 1HP so I need to be careful. Breach is unavailable. I'm currently behind Lifeline (facing W, I'm to their east). I can move to (4,4) which is adjacent and behind Lifeline, then use shadow_strike to deal 1 damage while staying cloaked. Wait — I'm not cloaked. At 1HP I'm very fragile. Lifeline is the enemy healer and is only 2 tiles away. If I move to (4,4) I'm adjacent and can shadow_strike for 1 damage. Shadow_strike keeps cloak but I'm not cloaked — it deals 1 damage from adjacent. Actually shadow_strike just requires adjacent range and deals 1 damage. Lifeline at 1 damage could be worth it to disrupt healing. Moving to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Lifeline. I should move to (4,4) and shadow_strike Lifeline at (3,4). This kills or damages the medic which helps my team significantly.

Orders are to move away from allies and toward open ground. I'm at (3,4). Phantom is adjacent at (4,4) — critical but I shouldn't engage. Weaver is at (3,2) — must avoid getting adjacent. Moving to (5,5) gets me to open ground in the far corner, away from allies (Hawk at 5,2 is 3 tiles away, Rampart at 1,3 is far). That's a good open position. I'll move toward (5,4) first then wait, or move to (5,5) directly. Valid moves include (5,5) — distance 3 from (3,4): |5-3|+|5-4|=3, within mv3. Moving there puts me far from Weaver and open ground.

Phantom is at critical HP and in range at dist=3. Priority is to secure the kill with precision_shot. I haven't moved yet so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Weaver is 2 tiles away — must NOT move adjacent. Current position (5,2) has LoS to Phantom at (4,4). I'll fire precision_shot at Phantom to finish them off, then wait or hold position.

Rampart is adjacent at (1,3) to my north. I'm fortified (50% dmg reduction) and have 5/8 HP. Rampart is healthy and threatening. I should attack Rampart since it's adjacent, and stay put to keep Fortify active. No need to move — attacking in place preserves the damage reduction bonus.

I'm fortified at (1,3) with 4/8 HP, Bastion is adjacent at (1,2). I should attack Bastion while keeping fortify active — that means staying put. Attack Bastion, then shield_wall facing South to block any threats coming from that direction, or East toward Weaver's side. Bastion is to my South at (1,2), so shield_wall South protects from Bastion's attacks. Attack first, then shield_wall South.

Hawk is at (5,2), distance 2, in range. I can attack Hawk directly. But first, I should consider trap placement. (4,2) already has a trap. Valid moves include (4,1) and (4,3) which would close distance to Hawk. If I move to (4,2) - wait, that already has a trap, so I can't move there. Valid move tiles include (4,1) and (4,3). Moving to (4,1) keeps me close to Hawk and lets me attack. Actually, I'm at (3,2) and Hawk is at (5,2) - distance 2, within range 2, so I can attack now. Let me attack Hawk then place a trap at (4,3) to cut off Hawk's retreat/movement path. (4,3) is a valid trap target (within 2 tiles of me). This harasses Hawk and zones the area.

Orders are to move away from allies and toward open ground. Current position (5,5) is a corner. Allies are at (5,2) and (1,3). Moving to (3,5) or (3,4) gets me away from Hawk at (5,2) and into more open ground. Phantom is critical at (4,4) nearby but orders say move away, not engage. I'll move to (3,5) to create distance from allies and open up the board.

I'm at 1HP so I need to be very careful. Breach is unavailable. Lifeline (enemy medic) is only distance 2 and I'm already behind her — if I move to (4,5) I'll be adjacent and behind. Shadow_strike keeps cloak, dealing 1 damage. She's healthy so I won't kill her, but hitting the medic is high value. I'm cloaked (facing W suggests I moved recently), so I should move to (4,5) then shadow_strike Lifeline at (3,5). This damages the healer while staying cloaked and safe at 1HP.

Phantom is at critical HP at (4,5), distance 4 — out of my range 2. Bastion is wounded at (1,2), distance 4 — also out of range. Weaver is at (3,2), distance 2, in range but healthy and I must avoid moving adjacent. Orders say target most wounded enemy; neither wounded enemy is in range. Weaver is the only in-range target but is healthy. I should try to reposition to get Phantom (critical) in range without getting adjacent to Weaver. Moving to (5,4) would put me at distance 3 from Phantom — still out of range 2. Moving to (4,3) puts me at distance 2 from Phantom (4,5): dist = |4-4|+|3-5|=2, in range! But I must check adjacency to Weaver at (3,2): from (4,3) dist to Weaver = |4-3|+|3-2|=2, not adjacent. Safe. From (4,3) I can precision_shot Phantom at (4,5) for 2 damage to finish the critical target. This is the priority move.

I'm at (3,2) with traps already at (2,3), (3,3), (4,2), (2,4). Hawk is at (4,3) healthy and within range 2. The tile (4,2) already has a trap. Hawk might move south toward me or stay. I should place a trap on a likely enemy path. (5,3) or (4,1) could be good but I need to check valid moves vs trap placement range. Valid moves include (4,2) but that has a trap. I can place a trap anywhere within 2 tiles of my current position on empty tiles. My position (3,2). Tiles within 2: checking for empty tiles not yet trapped. (4,1) is within range 2 (dist=sqrt(1+1)=1.4), empty, good trap spot anticipating Hawk movement south. I could also move to (4,1) first then trap. Better: place trap at (5,2) - Hawk could move there. Actually (5,2) is dist 2 from me, valid. Or I could move to (5,2) and place trap on (5,3) to cut off Hawk. Let me move to (4,1) to reposition, then place trap at (5,2) which would be within 2 of new position. From (4,1): (5,2) is dist sqrt(1+1)=1.4, in range. That tiles off Hawk's southern escape. Actually simpler: stay and place trap at (4,1) - enemies moving south from (4,3) would pass through (4,2)[trapped] or (4,1). Place trap at (5,3) - within 2 of (3,2)? dist=sqrt(4+1)=2.24, no. Place at (4,3) - Hawk is there, can't trap occupied. Place at (5,2) - dist 2, valid empty tile, Hawk might move here. Do that, then move toward (4,1) to pressure.

I'm fortified at (1,3) with 4/8 HP, facing Bastion at (1,2) who is wounded. I have fortify active giving 50% damage reduction since I didn't move last turn. Bastion is adjacent and wounded — I should attack to finish them off. If I move, I lose fortify. Best play: stay put, attack Bastion, and use shield_wall to protect allies from the south threat (Weaver at (4,1)). Actually, Weaver is a vector with denial range adjacent — not immediately threatening. Bastion is the priority. Attack Bastion first, then shield_wall south to cover against any incoming. But if I don't move, I keep fortify. Attack Bastion now.

Rampart is adjacent at (1,3) and wounded — attack to finish them off. I'm fortified so no move needed; staying put preserves the 50% damage reduction. Attack Rampart first, then wait to keep fortify active.

Hawk is critically low at 3/4 HP and is my priority target for healing. He's at (4,3), dist=3 from me. I need to move adjacent to him to use patch. Moving to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Hawk at (4,3) — that's 1 south of me, which is adjacent. From valid moves, (4,4) is available. Then I can patch Hawk to restore 2HP.

Bastion is wounded but out of range at dist=4. Weaver is in range at dist=2 and is healthy. Orders say target most wounded first, then enemy medic if no wounded. Bastion is wounded but I can't reach it this turn without moving adjacent to Weaver. I'm at (4,3), Weaver is at (4,1) — dist=2, so I can use precision_shot on Weaver without being adjacent. I have not moved, so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Should I move to get Bastion in range? Moving toward Bastion at (1,2) would require closing distance significantly, and Weaver is between us effectively. Best play: precision_shot Weaver from current position (in range, not adjacent, full damage).

I'm at (4,1) with traps already at (4,2) between me and Hawk at (4,3). Hawk is healthy and moving south toward me - the trap at (4,2) should catch them. I need to place another trap to funnel enemies. Lifeline is at (4,4) moving south - could step onto (4,3) or (4,2). I should place a trap at (5,2) - wait, that's already trapped. Let me place at (3,2) to cover lateral movement, or move to (5,1) and trap (5,2) - already trapped. Best: place trap at (3,2) to cover Hawk's potential dodge around my existing trap line, then move to (5,1) to maintain distance from Hawk while staying near the trap cluster.

Rampart (wounded sentinel) is adjacent at (1,3) - I can attack it. I'm fortified so I have 50% damage reduction. If I move, I lose fortify. Best play: attack Rampart while fortified, then wait to keep the damage reduction for next turn. No need to move - I'm already on the front line between allies and enemies.

I'm at (1,3) with 2HP, fortified. Bastion is adjacent at (1,2), wounded. I should attack Bastion to finish it off while maintaining fortify bonus. If I don't move, fortify stays active giving 50% damage reduction. Attack Bastion then wait to keep fortified status.

Rampart is critically wounded at 2/8 HP and needs a heal urgently. I'm at (4,4) and Rampart is at (1,3), distance 4. I need to close distance. Moving to (2,4) gets me closer but still not adjacent. Best move toward Rampart: go to (2,4) which puts me at distance 2 from Rampart. Actually let me check: from (2,4) to (1,3) is dist=sqrt(1+1)=1.4, so adjacent diagonally — need to check if adjacency is orthogonal only. Likely orthogonal: from (2,4) to (1,3) would be diagonal so not adjacent. From (2,3) to (1,3) = dist 1, adjacent! I can move to (2,3) which is in valid moves, then patch Rampart at (1,3).

Bastion is critical but out of range at dist=4. Weaver is healthy but in range at dist=3. Orders say target most wounded enemy to secure kills, but Bastion is out of range. I need to close on Bastion. Moving to (3,2) gets me closer to Bastion (dist would be ~2) while staying away from Weaver. From (3,2), Bastion at (1,2) is dist=2, in range for precision_shot. Let me check: I haven't moved yet so precision_shot does full 2dmg. Move to (3,2) first, then precision_shot Bastion.

I'm at 1HP with fortify active giving 50% damage reduction. Rampart is adjacent at (1,3) to my north. I should attack Rampart while staying fortified. If I move, I lose fortify. Best play: attack Rampart (adjacent), then wait to keep fortify bonus.

I'm at (5,1) with no enemies in range. I have a trap at (5,2) already. Hawk is at (3,2) moving south, likely to pass through (4,2) - already trapped. I should move closer to support Bastion who is critical, and place a trap on a likely enemy path. Moving to (4,1) gets me closer while keeping options open. From there I can place a trap at (3,1) to catch Hawk if they advance south.
Bastion is adjacent at (1,2) and critical. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Best play: attack Bastion to finish them off, then wait to keep fortify active for defense. No need to move.

Rampart is adjacent to me at (1,3) and wounded (7/8). Hawk is at dist=2 at (3,2) with only 3/4 HP and critically needs healing. I have 1 patch left. Priority: heal Rampart now since they're adjacent, then move toward Hawk for overclock next round. Weaver is at dist=4, no threat yet.

Weaver is at (4,1), distance 2 from my position (3,2). I have LoS and am not adjacent. I can use precision_shot for 2 damage. I haven't moved yet so full damage applies. Stay in place to maintain range advantage and avoid adjacency.

Weaver is at (4,1), distance 5 - out of reach. Allies Hawk at (3,2) and Lifeline at (3,3) are healthy. Currently fortified at (1,3). I should advance to close the gap and position between allies and the enemy. Moving to (2,2) puts me closer to the front while keeping fortify viable next turn if I stay put. Better to move to (2,3) to stay in line with allies and intercept path. Then wait to maintain fortify next turn.

Hawk is at (3,2) dist=2, in range. Traps already at (4,2),(3,1),(5,2) covering nearby tiles. I need to place traps on tiles enemies are likely to move through. Hawk is moving S toward me, Rampart and Lifeline are also approaching. Tile (4,0) or (5,1) could be good for area denial. But first — I can attack Hawk at dist=2 with attack (adjacent only means dist=1, so attack won't work). My abilities: trap (range ≤2), pulse (1 tile AoE adjacent). Hawk is at dist=2 so not adjacent — pulse won't hit. I should place a trap on a tile Hawk is likely to step on. Hawk is at (3,2) moving S — likely next steps: (3,1) already trapped! Good. Rampart at (2,2) moving S — (2,1) is reachable. I can move to (3,1) but that's already trapped (dangerous for me). Let me move to (5,1) to reposition slightly and place a trap at (4,2) — wait, (4,2) already trapped. Place trap at (3,0) — Hawk moving S from (3,1) (already trapped) might go to (3,0). Or move to (2,1) to trap that tile for Rampart. I'm at (4,1), move to (3,1) is risky (trap there). Move to (2,1) is valid (dist check: |4-2|+|1-1|=2, yes valid). Then place trap at (3,1)... already trapped. Place trap somewhere useful from (2,1): can reach tiles within 2. From (2,1): (2,2) where Rampart is — perfect trap placement directly on Rampart's position or (3,0),(1,0),(2,0). Actually placing trap ON enemy tile may not work (must be empty). Rampart at (2,2) — if I place trap at (1,2) or (2,3) for their path. Let me just move to (3,0) and place trap at (2,1) — likely path for enemies coming south.

Patch is unavailable (0 uses left). Hawk is wounded at 3HP but I can't heal. Hawk is adjacent at (3,2). I can overclock Hawk to give them 2 abilities next turn, which could help them deal with Weaver. Weaver is at dist=3, so I need to stay away. I'll overclock Hawk first, then consider positioning.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Weaver is at (3,0), dist=2, in range. I'm at (3,2). I should use precision_shot twice on Weaver. I haven't moved so no penalty. I need to stay at dist=2 to avoid Vector denial. Two precision_shots at 2dmg each should eliminate Weaver if they're healthy (assuming 4HP vector would need more, but let's maximize damage).

Weaver is 3 tiles away at (3,0), wounded but out of attack range. I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction — valuable to maintain. Hawk is at (3,2) adjacent to me, Lifeline at (4,3). Weaver is south and could threaten Hawk. I should move to (3,1) to get between Weaver and Hawk, positioning to intercept or attack next round. But moving breaks fortify. Alternative: stay fortified and use shield_wall south to protect Hawk from Weaver's approach. Shield_wall toward S from current position (2,2) would protect adjacent ally Hawk at (3,2)... but direction covers N/S/E/W from my tile. Hawk is east of me, not south. Shield_wall S would protect allies south of me — no ally is directly south. Better to move to (3,1) — puts me between Weaver at (3,0) and Hawk at (3,2), adjacent to Weaver for attack, and I can attack. Moving to (3,1) is valid per move tiles.

Rampart is adjacent at (3,1) and Hawk is at (3,2) - two enemies very close. Pulse hits all units within 1 tile, so from (3,0) I can hit Rampart at dist=1.
